WRITING.TEXT: Watch Afflicted if you havent that was my favorite one so far. I enjoyed how it showed the suffering and process of turning into a vampire, most vampire movies just have the people instantly turn into vampires. The first time I watched it I was blown away. For sure the best found footage movie i've seen besides The blair witch project.
Yes it was Thinner, thank you very much.

WRITING.TITLE: Thriller/horror where gypsy is stalking a man?
WRITING.TEXT: I am trying to figure out what this movie is called where this guy steals from a creepy gypsy and then he is cursed by her and keeps seeing her where ever he goes. Theres one part I specifically remember where he sees a pie in a kitchen and the inside starts moving and a hand comes out of the pie I think. I know this is vague but its all I remember, any help I would appreciate.

Best Thriller movie suggestions? Preferably 2010-2016
WRITING.TEXT: I'd like some suggestions on some good thriller movies, preferably recent or new thriller/horror movies. All the Thrillers ive seen: The Descent, Seven, Black christmas, The thing, Scarface, Open your eyes, The Conspiracy V/H/S Stir of echoes, You're next Psycho, Cube, Taxi Driver, The Shining, Training Day, Harsh Times, Under The Skin, Jacobs Ladder, The Conjuring, Visions, Mesrine:Killer instinct, In Fear, Requiem for a dream, Pi, Kill Bill, The Babadook, There will be blood, Tusk, Battle Royal, The Gift, Curve, Final Destination, Jaws, Dirt Harry, Contagion, Scream, Hobo with a shotgun, Hush, Gone Girl, Nightcrawler, The guest, The purge, Green Room, Heat, Silence of the lambs, Knock Knock, The usual suspects Resvoir dogs Street kings, The invitation, Coherence, Regression, 10 Cloverfield Lane, The Shallows, District 9, The fourth kind, The house of the devil, Cloverfield, Martyrs, Saw, Eden Lake, Wanted, The hurt locker, The midnight meat train, Bronson, Jeepers creepers, No country for old men, Death Proof, Eastern Promises, 28 days later, The hills have eyes, V for vendetta, Wolf creek, Dark water, The machinist, The butterfly effect, Dawn of the dead, the forgotten, The grudge, the ring, Taking lives, 13 sins, Underworld, Oldboy, High tension, Ichi the killer, 13 assassins, Panic room, xxx, May, Cabin fever, Memento, American Pyscho, Shutter island, The Sixth Sense, Black Swan, Mullholand Drive, Fight club, Cape Fear, Enemy at the gates, Armageddon, American History x, Natural born killers, The Jacket, From Dusk Till Dawn....

Definitely watch The Taking Of Debrah Logan. I thought Afflicted was the best out of all the found footage movies I've seen. It was cool seeing someone go through the process of turning into a vampire and struggling with it instead of turning right into a vampire like most vampire movies. The two guys in the film actually wrote and directed it themselves, pretty impressive for there first/only film.
Nope ill check it out for sure
Ive seen most of those but I will check out The last broadcast, Home Movie, Megan Is missing and Muirhouse
Seen it, the only part I enjoyed was the ending of the movie and realizing what they have ventured into.

Thanks, Ive also seen The Sacrament, August Underground, The last excorcism, The Borderlands, Paranormal Entity, Devil's pass, Banshee Chapter, The houses that october built, Atrocious, and Devils Due. These were all the ones I didnt really like so I didnt put them on the list.
Any U.S remake of a foreign horror movie isnt very good, and Quarantine is one of them.
